author: Zahra Mulroy
title: The 'worst actor' in the world revealed - and he's really not happy about it
text:
Everyone knows about the Academy Awards . 
Seen as the zenith of the film industry's awards season , the Oscars were established to honour the best films and talent of the previous year. 
But there's also another important awarding body who have been working behind the scenes, albeit with a very different purpose in mind. 
Everyone's seen a rubbish film. 
A film which, for a variety reasons, was so bad, you wanted to tear your hair out. 
It could have been the acting, the script, the plot or maybe even a combination of all three. 
The 'Razzies' are the awards which pay homage to these cinematic disasters and provide a more light-hearted alternative to the worthy old Oscars. This Sunday will mark the 37th Golden Raspberry Awards. 
Some A-list celebrities are actually quite good sports about their nominations. 
As The LAD Bible reports, Halle Berry poked fun at her own emotional Oscars acceptance speech when she picked up her Worst Actress Razzie for Catwoman. Halle Berry made fun of her own speech (Photo: PA) 
Similarly, Sandra Bullock managed to abandon her ego when she accepted her Razzie for The Blind Side - in the same year she won an Oscar for it - with a hilarious speech. 
Other members of the Hollywood elite, however, have a bit of a sense of humour failure about it. Read More It's Oscars time - so take a look back at the people and films who have broken records Sandra Bullock holds her Oscar for best actress in "The Blind Side" (Photo: REUTERS) 
Spare a thought for Sylvester Stallone, who has the dubious honour of having been nominated 30 times and has won the Worst Actor award four times. 
On hearing he was nominate for - seriously - the Worst Actor of the Century award in 2000, he supposedly left a voicemail for Golden Raspberry founder and president John Wilson. Actor Sylvester Stallone arrives at the 88th Oscar Nominees Luncheon (Photo: Getty) 
"When he heard he was up for Worst Actor of the Century, we did get a voice mail that sounded like him - for legal reasons we can't say it was him," Wilson told The Hollywood Reporter . 
"But his point was, my movies make money, stop picking on me.'" Read More Stallone and family at the Golden Globes (Photo: REUTERS) 
"You're not exempt from the Razzies if your movie made money." 
Stallone should not be too disheartened at his Razzie infamy. 
Even Laurence Olivier got a nod for Inchon in 1982, proving that the awards are a breath of fresh, irreverent air in an industry awash with egos and hangers-on. Like us on Facebook
